bibl.title: Letter from Guillermo Garcia Lopez to Tom D. Spies, October 2, 1951

div1.p: Lopez recommends that the Hench's stay at the Casa La Rosa, in Varadero, Cuba.

div1.head: Letter from Guillermo Garcia Lopez to Tom D. Spies, October 2, 1951
div1.opener:
DR. GUILLERMO GARCIA LOPEZ
CONSULTAS PREVIA CITA
4 No. 512 ENTRE 21 Y 23
TELF. F-5143 - VEDADO
HABANA
October 2, 1951
Dr. Tom D. Spies
Nutrition Clinic
Hillman Hospital
Birmingham, Alabama.
Dear Tom:
div1.p:
I was in Varadero last Saturday trying to know of some pleasant
and not very expensive place for Dr. and Mrs. Phillip Hench and Mr. and
Mrs. Gray. Every place down there charge twice as much money for the
Winter Season. To me, the best of some places that are in front of the
sea and serve good meals is the “House La Rosa”. Its prices are included
for two persons; in other words, 14 to 15 dollars dayly for every person.
The prices at the International Hotel, for instance, are about the same
but only for the room, they do not include meals.

If you want, let me know if you consider acceptable the prior
and I can do the reservations with time enough, because I go in Saturday
to Varadero. I understand the reservations should be done as soon as
possible since La Rosa is a not very big house and has many americans
and cubans clients. I could choice the best rooms and speak personnally
to them but, if you wish to write them directly, what I believe it is
not necessary, you can mention my name. The address is: “Casa La Rosa,
Varadero, Cardenas, Cuba.”

You know how much I wish to find a good place to Dr. Hench and
his guests and to anybody else you would want. It is important for me
to know how long they plan to spend at the beach. If they still considere
these prices are high I can look for another house, even though, of course,
I may not reccomend it as I do with this one.
div1.closer: Yours very truly, Dr. Guillermo García López GGL:ac.
